conclusion: Determine the distance OP given conditions of total internal reflection and angle of incidence.
Light is incident at an angle of θ = 60° and totally internally reflected at the circular surface.
After exiting, the light is parallel to the incident light.
For total internal reflection, θc is the critical angle related to refractive index n by sin θc = 1/n.
Given light exits parallel to incident light, angle of refraction θr is 0°.
Snell's Law: n1 sin θi = n2 sin θr.
n1 = n (glass), n2 = 1 (air), and sin θr = 0.
Using critical angle condition: sin 60° = √3/2 = 1/n, therefore n = 2/√3 = 2√3/3.
Light travels from P to point of total internal reflection on circular surface.
Distance OP is radius R of semi-circular glass brick.
Light travels from P to point of reflection at angle of 60°.
Distance OP is R multiplied by cosine of angle 60°: OP = R cos 60° = R/2.
Final Answer: Distance OP is R/2.
